conclusion: The working principle of the electromagnetic railgun involves a projectile moving between two parallel rails with current flowing through it, generating a magnetic field and propelling the projectile forward due to the Lorentz force.
Power is defined as work done per unit time, or force times velocity: P = F * v.
The force on the projectile is F = 1 T * 10 A * 0.5 m = 5 N.
The acceleration of the projectile is a = 5 N / 0.02 kg = 250 m/s².
The velocity at the end of the rails is v = sqrt(250) ≈ 15.81 m/s.
The power at launch is P = 5 N * 15.81 m/s ≈ 79.05 W.
